input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a brother has a direct effect on vaccination reaction and getting smallpox. Getting smallpox has a direct effect on smallpox survival. Vaccination reaction has a direct effect on smallpox survival. The overall probability of having a brother is 97%. The probability of not having a brother and smallpox survival is 1%. The probability of having a brother and smallpox survival is 52%. Is the chance of smallpox survival larger when observing having a brother?
